"No, you don't understand!" 
And Rostov got up and went wandering among the campfires, dreaming of what happi- ness it would be to die not in saving the Em- peror's life (he did not even dare to dream of that), but simply to die before his eyes. He really was in love with the Tsar and the glory of the Russian arms and the hope of future triumph. And he was not the only man to ex- perience that feeling during those memorable days preceding the battle of Austcrli
